repositories.brief_summary: Active week with new stdlib features, ARM64 improvements, and ongoing language feature development
repositories.new_features_summary: Format.format_text function, Runtime_events timestamp access, ARM64 unaligned memory access, Windows CSPRNG seeding
repositories.new_features:
- **Format.format_text function** added to stdlib for text formatting with automatic break hints [3ca06d6e](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/3ca06d6e669aed7ca457d20f10fca133a38dc381)
- **Runtime_events.Timestamp.get_current** function for accessing current timestamps [41d0c600](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/41d0c6009b27935109345f4491aae514f624bb3f)
- **ARM64 unaligned memory access** support enabled by setting allow_unaligned_access to true [7ed394b8](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/7ed394b8dc3f1befdc4883f88e2ae311567409ae)
- **Windows CSPRNG random seeding** using OS cryptographically secure random number generator [3ca06d6e](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/3ca06d6e669aed7ca457d20f10fca133a38dc381)
- **Enhanced spellchecker hints** that preserve module context ("Fun.protact" suggests "Fun.protect" instead of just "protect") [22ab57de](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/22ab57de9c1ce8e4e313fa26b46bf90d2f549167)
- **Improved module type constraints** with distinction between `(module M : S)` and `(module M) : (module S)` syntax [c8f31846](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/c8f318463f7127f1463fe446916a4b89e99267ab)
- **Build system improvements** including cross-compiler simplification and autotools updates [dd47dcfa](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/dd47dcfa112ad3feec66c0cc4287f141df379555)
repositories.activity_summary: Two new PRs opened this week alongside merged PRs for type system enhancements and continued work on modular explicits
repositories.activity:
- **Two new PRs opened** this week: [Polymorphic Parameters](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13806) by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) adding function parameters with polymorphic types, and [add -print-variance and Asttypes.Bivariant](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13820) by [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s) for variance debugging support
- **Type system enhancements merged** including [Add a new type kind `Type_external`](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13712) by [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s) and the variance printing functionality ([#13820](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13820))
- **Ongoing major language features** continue development with [Modular explicits](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13275) by [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) receiving updates, and [Structured diagnostics for the compiler](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13766) by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) progressing
- **Standard library enhancements** delivered through Format module improvements and runtime events extensions by multiple contributors
- **Platform support improvements** with ARM64 optimizations and Windows-specific enhancements for better cross-platform compatibility
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on type system enhancements, platform optimization, and tooling improvements for developer experience
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Type system sophistication** with polymorphic parameters, external type kinds, and variance annotations improving OCaml's expressiveness for advanced programming patterns
- **Platform optimization focus** including ARM64 performance improvements and Windows-specific enhancements for better cross-platform development
- **Developer tooling enhancements** through structured diagnostics, improved error messages, and spellchecker improvements for better development experience
- **Standard library expansion** with Format module enhancements and runtime events capabilities supporting modern development needs
repositories.contributors_summary: Active contributions from compiler team members focusing on language features, stdlib improvements, and platform support
repositories.contributors:
- [Zachary Vance](https://github.com/za3k) opened feature request for missing signals in stdlib ([#13825](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13825))
- [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) continued work on modular explicits ([#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13275)) and contributed module type constraint improvements and type variable validation fixes
- [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s) opened new PR for variance printing support ([#13820](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13820)) and had Type_external feature merged ([#13712](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13712))
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) opened major polymorphic parameters PR ([#13806](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13806)) bringing function parameters with polymorphic types to the language
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) continued structured diagnostics work ([#13766](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13766)) and contributed spellchecker and module constraint fixes
- [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) worked on C++ API compatibility ([#13777](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/13777)) and contributed Windows CSPRNG seeding and build system improvements

repositories.brief_summary: Three new PRs opened by R. Boujbel covering repos-config syntax redesign, opam admin improvements, and CI testing enhancements
repositories.new_features_summary: Added new W74 lint warning and fixed pin-depends with with-* variables; API improvements for lock_kind parameters
repositories.new_features:
- **New lint warning W74** detects pin-depends packages missing from depends/depopts fields [#6317](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6317)
- **Fixed pin-depends** handling for packages with with-* variables in lock files [#5471](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/5471)
- **API improvement** making lock_kind parameters non-optional in OpamStateConfig and OpamSwitchState to prevent library breakage [#5488](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/5488)
- **GHA infrastructure** avoiding broken diffutils 3.11 release in CI [#6392](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6392)
repositories.activity_summary: Three new PRs opened addressing repository configuration syntax, admin commands, and CI testing for opam library dependencies
repositories.activity:
- **New repos-config syntax** redesign by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) implementing cleaner section-based format to replace current list-based approach ([#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6393))
- **Opam admin improvements** by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) enforcing repository root checks and adding upgrade advice for better error handling ([#6391](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6391))
- **CI testing enhancement** merged by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) adding job to test opam library dependencies compilation, keeping them synchronized with current API ([#6394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6394))
- **Archive cache optimization** ongoing work by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) to avoid double symlinks in cache, with consideration for potential download impacts ([#6100](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6100))
repositories.discussions_summary: Design discussion on opam list parameter behavior and upcoming harmonization of selectors for version 2.4
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Opam list parameter interaction** between --latests-only and --depends-on flags discussed by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), with dev meeting consensus on merging package and state selectors ([#6387](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6387))
- **Repos-config syntax** review feedback from [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) requesting OpamPp crash course and suggesting removal of soft/hard upgrade distinction ([#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6393))
- **Repository version support** discussion on whether opam admin should refuse 1.2 repositories versus maintaining backward compatibility ([#6391](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6391))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on internal API improvements and repository management infrastructure with emphasis on future-proofing and cleaner syntax
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Repository configuration modernization** with move toward section-based syntax for easier parsing and field addition ([#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6393))
- **API stability improvements** making optional parameters explicit to prevent library user breakage during opam root upgrades ([#5488](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/5488))
- **Enhanced lint capabilities** expanding package validation to catch dependency mismatches in pin-depends declarations ([#6317](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6317))
- **CI infrastructure robustness** improving testing coverage for library dependencies and avoiding problematic upstream releases ([#6394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6394), [#6392](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6392))
repositories.contributors_summary: Two core contributors active: R. Boujbel driving major feature development and Kate providing comprehensive code reviews
repositories.contributors:
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) implemented lint warning W74 for pin-depends validation ([#6317](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6317)), opened repos-config syntax redesign ([#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6393)), enhanced opam admin commands ([#6391](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6391)), and added CI testing for library dependencies ([#6394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6394))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) provided extensive code review feedback across multiple PRs including syntax suggestions and architectural improvements ([#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6393), [#6391](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6391), [#6394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6394)), opened issue about opam list parameter interactions ([#6387](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6387)), and implemented lock_kind API improvements ([#5488](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/5488))

repositories.brief_summary: Modernization week with Nix infrastructure updates for OCaml 5.3 support and Stdune dependency cleanup across 14 PRs
repositories.new_features_summary: Added OCaml 5.3 support in Nix configuration and refactored String module implementation to reduce Stdune dependencies
repositories.new_features:
- **OCaml 5.3 support** added to Nix build configuration with updated flake dependencies and build setup ([#1473](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1473), [#1477](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1477))
- **String module refactoring** consolidates string operations with explicit function mappings to reduce Stdune dependency ([#1479](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1479))
- **Nix infrastructure modernization** includes flake updates, deprecated `overrideScope'` removal, and improved overlay handling ([#1475](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1475), [#1476](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1476), [#1478](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1478), [#1481](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1481))
repositories.activity_summary: Three new PRs opened for ongoing Stdune cleanup alongside nine merged PRs completing Nix modernization and infrastructure updates
repositories.activity:
- **Three new PRs opened** this week continue the **Stdune dependency cleanup** initiative with [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) targeting List module removal ([#1480](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1480)), Int module cleanup ([#1482](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1482)), and complete stdune O references removal ([#1483](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1483))
- **Nine PRs merged** this week completing **Nix infrastructure overhaul** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) including OCaml 5.3 support ([#1473](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1473)), flake updates ([#1476](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1476)), deprecated API removal ([#1475](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1475)), and String module refactoring ([#1479](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1479))
- **Dependency update automation** continued with [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) submitting multiple @swc/core version bumps that were ultimately closed in favor of newer versions ([#1469](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1469), [#1471](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1471), [#1472](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1472))
repositories.trends_summary: Infrastructure modernization focus with systematic Stdune dependency reduction and Nix build system updates for newer OCaml versions
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Systematic dependency cleanup** trend with multiple PRs targeting removal of Stdune components ([#1480](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1480), [#1482](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1482), [#1483](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1483), [#1403](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1403)) suggesting broader refactoring initiative
- **OCaml version advancement** with Nix configuration updated to support OCaml 5.3 while removing 5.1 support ([#1473](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1473), [#1484](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1484)), indicating version lifecycle management
- **Build system modernization** through Nix flake updates and deprecated API removal showing commitment to current tooling standards ([#1475](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1475), [#1476](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1476))
repositories.contributors_summary: Single primary contributor with Rudi Grinberg leading infrastructure modernization and automated dependency management by Dependabot
repositories.contributors:
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) authored all functional changes this week including OCaml 5.3 Nix support ([#1473](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1473), [#1477](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1477)), String module refactoring ([#1479](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1479)), and comprehensive Nix infrastructure updates ([#1474](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1474), [#1475](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1475), [#1476](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1476), [#1478](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1478), [#1481](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1481), [#1484](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1484))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) submitted automated dependency updates for @swc/core versions that were closed in favor of newer releases ([#1469](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1469), [#1471](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1471), [#1472](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1472))

repositories.brief_summary: New RFC proposal for implicit source positions and continued discussion on include functor feature
repositories.activity_summary: One new RFC opened proposing implicit source positions with continued discussion on include functor
repositories.activity:
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) opened **implicit source positions RFC** ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52)) proposing a new arrow type syntax `loc:[%call_pos] ->` that automatically fills function parameters with call site positions, useful for **monadic bind tracing** and **testing framework improvements**
- Ongoing **technical discussion** on the `include functor` RFC ([#43](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/43)) by [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) with [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) confirming **language committee involvement** and extensive debate about syntax alternatives involving [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche), [François Pottier](https://github.com/fpottier), and others
repositories.discussions_summary: Active technical discussions on implicit source positions implementation and include functor design
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Implicit source positions implementation details** discussed by [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) noting the feature's **production use at Jane Street** for several months, with [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) confirming broad **maintainer consensus** and discussing integration with `BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP` ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52))
- **Directory handling concerns** raised by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) about potential conflicts with existing build path mapping, while [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) provided insights on **Dune workspace behavior** and noted **LexiFi's previous implementation** ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52))
- **Include functor syntax debate** continuing with [François Pottier](https://github.com/fpottier) suggesting `this` keyword for **current module reference** and [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) exploring alternatives like `include F(module)` syntax for more **expressive module composition** ([#43](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/43))
repositories.trends_summary: Language design discussions emphasizing practical industrial experience and build tool integration
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Industrial validation approach** where features like implicit source positions gain traction through **Jane Street production experience** before upstream adoption, as noted by [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52))
- **Build system integration awareness** with discussions emphasizing compatibility with **Dune** and **BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP**, showing increased attention to practical deployment concerns ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52))
- **Language committee engagement** for complex features like `include functor` as confirmed by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron), indicating more **structured review processes** for advanced language constructs ([#43](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/43))
repositories.contributors_summary: Olivier Nicole opened new RFC with extensive community discussion involving language committee and industry experts
repositories.contributors:
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) opened the **implicit source positions RFC** ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52)) and engaged with community feedback on implementation details
- [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) provided **Jane Street production insights** on implicit source positions and credited implementation work by internal developers ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) provided **technical analysis** on both RFCs, discussing build system integration and alternative syntax proposals ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52), [#43](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/43))
- [François Pottier](https://github.com/fpottier) contributed **language design perspectives** on module reference mechanisms and syntax alternatives for the include functor feature ([#43](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/43))
- [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) shared **build system expertise** regarding Dune behavior and noted **LexiFi's historical implementation** of similar features ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52))
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) raised **build integration concerns** about BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP compatibility ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52))
- [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) requested **language committee review** for the include functor RFC and engaged in ongoing syntax discussions ([#43](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/43))
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) confirmed **committee shepherd assignment** process for complex language features ([#43](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/43))

repositories.brief_summary: LaTeX image support, JSON header field, driver package validation, CSS indentation fixes, and warnings system improvements merged this week
repositories.new_features_summary: LaTeX backend gained PNG/PDF/JPEG image support, JSON output added header field, driver validates packages and improved warnings handling
repositories.new_features:
- **LaTeX backend image support** for PNG, PDF, and JPEG formats by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) ([#1297](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1297))
- **JSON output header field** addition to improve integration with websites by [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) ([#1314](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1314))
- **Package validation** in odoc_driver to warn about missing or unknown opam packages by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([#1311](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1311))
- **Warnings system refactoring** replacing `--suppress-warnings` with `--warnings-tag` for better caching compatibility by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([#1304](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1304))
- **CSS indentation fix** for verbatim blocks within tags to resolve inheritance issues by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([#1312](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1312))
- **Virtual library handling** improvements in odoc_driver for docs-ci compatibility by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([#1309](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1309))
- **Error handling** enhancement preventing backtraces on invalid compile-deps input by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([#1313](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1313))
- **HTML fragment** generation fixes for headings in `odoc html-fragment` command by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([#1306](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1306))

- **Runtime events stability fixes** including proper ring buffer state handling, lock management for ephemeron debugging, and STW participant set management ([5a3ff8f](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/5a3ff8f1a4e146525d36484dff4b98883fe71dbf), [81eb640](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/81eb64016901a46a60276001eb5dc7efb4b4cf3a), [42cfe50](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/42cfe50b3a1b0c370c63b1b861295b99c260729c), [00eaf7c](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/00eaf7cf764d5c60b0ab98a731c9bcd56664da96), [73343dc](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/73343dcee82fe5aba038be79e5082a328b999dd1))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Package ecosystem maintenance with major library updates in opam-repository and documentation quality improvements on ocaml.org
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Major melange, git libraries, F* releases in packages; new book and duplicate page removal on website
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Melange 5.0.1** JavaScript backend toolchain release with OCaml 5.1.1 requirement in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/a682e09815597086671421a0fc29a8656f156fe9)
- **Git libraries 3.18.0** comprehensive update across four git-related packages in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/7e11968a0543cd76c28fb5c432917c6ee2c60ec2)
- **F* 2025.02.17** functional programming language compiler release in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/52d7426ee14a9bdb6071124c7546b1e447003fff)
- **New libbinaryen 116.0.0** WebAssembly code generation library package in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/49d275f7228fcf3c5527d9920d15b6f9578d3795)
- **"Learn Programming with OCaml" book** added to ocaml.org books section with free PDF download ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2962](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2962))
- **Duplicate editor configuration page** removed from ocaml.org platform section with proper redirection ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2968](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2968))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Package maintenance focus** with 40+ coordinated commits in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) addressing major library updates including melange, git libraries, and F* compiler releases
- **Documentation quality improvements** in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) through comprehensive markdown formatting standardization and content organization by [Bozhidar Batsov](https://github.com/bbatsov)
- **Cross-platform compatibility** emphasis with macOS ARM, Windows, and Linux build fixes across the package repository ecosystem
- **Content expansion** on ocaml.org with new learning resources and automated blog post integration via OCaml Planet
group_summaries.activity_summary: Ecosystem maintenance through compatibility fixes, dependency updates, and systematic documentation improvements
group_summaries.activity:
- **Breaking change coordination** in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) managing PAF 0.8.0 updates across 15+ dependent packages ([ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/d9e1aebe14094da8df091c33358c5a2ccf782370))

- **OCaml compiler fixes** including 5.3.1 pointer correction and build system improvements ([ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/c88fbc7449b4b2b3183661a170ef62dde830dbc9))
- **Documentation standardization** by [Bozhidar Batsov](https://github.com/bbatsov) with comprehensive markdown formatting improvements ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2967](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2967))
- **Content maintenance** through company information updates by [Fabrice Le Fessant](https://github.com/lefessan) ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2970](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2970)) and metadata corrections by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2977](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2977))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **WebAssembly ecosystem coordination** with new libbinaryen package in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/49d275f7228fcf3c5527d9920d15b6f9578d3795) supporting melange toolchain JavaScript compilation improvements
- **Documentation quality alignment** between package maintenance practices in opam-repository and website documentation standards being established in ocaml.org through markdown linting discussions ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2966](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2966))
- **Community contributor overlap** with [Bozhidar Batsov](https://github.com/bbatsov) contributing to documentation quality in ocaml.org while package maintainers focus on ecosystem compatibility in opam-repository
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **macOS ARM OpenMP compatibility** discussed by [@nilsbecker](https://github.com/nilsbecker) regarding conf-openblas build failures affecting scientific computing packages ([ocaml/opam-repository#27483](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27483))
- **Markdown linting integration** discussion by [Jakub Svec](https://github.com/jakubsvec001) proposing Markdownlint.js for consistent formatting in ocaml.org ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2966](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2966))
- **OCAMLPATH environment configuration** debate by [Sylvain](https://github.com/Frigory33) about automatic OCAMLPATH setting to prevent cross-switch library conflicts ([ocaml/opam-repository#27495](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27495))

group_summaries.emerging_trends:

- **WebAssembly ecosystem expansion** through new libbinaryen bindings and enhanced melange toolchain supporting advanced JavaScript compilation targets

group_summaries.brief_summary: Tools group focused on modernization with OCaml 5.3 support, documentation improvements, and infrastructure updates across repositories
group_summaries.new_features_summary: LaTeX backend image support in odoc, opam lint warnings for pin-depends validation, OCaml 5.3 Nix support, and WASM runtime improvements
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Documentation generation** enhanced with LaTeX backend gaining PNG, PDF, and JPEG image support by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) ([ocaml/odoc#1297](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1297))
- **JSON output improvements** in odoc with new header field for website integration by [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) ([ocaml/odoc#1314](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1314))
- **Package validation** added to odoc_driver for opam package warnings by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([ocaml/odoc#1311](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1311))
- **Opam lint enhancement** with new W74 warning detecting pin-depends packages missing from dependencies by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) ([ocaml/opam#6317](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6317))
- **OCaml 5.3 support** added to ocaml-lsp Nix configuration with updated build dependencies by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1473](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1473))
- **WASM runtime improvements** in js_of_ocaml with type system cleanup renaming `$string` to `$bytes` and compilation process optimizations ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml@2b42149](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/2b421491629ebad4e43c006ca0f5dd8f7c15895d))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **High activity** in [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) with 8 merged PRs covering LaTeX image support, JSON metadata, and warnings system improvements
- **Infrastructure modernization** across [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) and [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) with OCaml 5.3 support and Nix build updates
- **Package management improvements** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) with new lint warnings and repository configuration syntax redesign
- **WASM backend development** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) with runtime type system cleanup and compilation optimizations
- **Limited activity** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune), [ocaml/opam-file-format](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-file-format), and [ocaml-dune/spawn](https://github.com/ocaml-dune/spawn) with no reported changes
group_summaries.activity_summary: Infrastructure maintenance dominated with Nix build updates, dependency cleanup, and repository configuration improvements alongside bug reporting
group_summaries.activity:
- **Build system modernization** by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) addressing Nix alcotest dependencies ([ocaml/merlin#1897](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1897)) and test formatting fixes ([ocaml/merlin#1899](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1899))
- **Dependency cleanup initiative** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) with ongoing Stdune module removal including List ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1480](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1480)), Int ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1482](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1482)), and String modules ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1479](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1479))
- **Repository configuration redesign** by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) implementing section-based syntax to replace list-based approach ([ocaml/opam#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6393))
- **Package download issues** reported by [Bessalah Fettoum](https://github.com/Lola969) for [ocaml/ocamlfind](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind) with HTTP 504 errors from camlcity.org ([ocaml/ocamlfind#98](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/98))
- **Bug reports** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) covering reactive table headers ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1837](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1837)) and WASM effect handler runtime errors ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1839](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1839))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **OCaml 5.3 adoption** coordinated across [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1473](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1473)) and [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) indicating synchronized version advancement strategy
- **Module opening order inconsistency** reported by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) between [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) and Dune affecting `Wasm_of_ocaml_compiler` builds ([ocaml/merlin#1900](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1900))
- **Documentation tooling integration** with [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) JSON metadata enhancements ([ocaml/odoc#1314](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1314)) supporting broader ecosystem website integration needs
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Code block indentation algorithms** in [ocaml/odoc#1317](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1317) with technical debate between CommonMark-style vs box model implementations involving [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) and [Noah Bogart](https://github.com/NoahTheDuke)
- **Opam list parameter interactions** in [ocaml/opam#6387](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6387) with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) discussing `--latests-only` and `--depends-on` flag behavior and dev meeting consensus on selector harmonization
- **WASM effect handlers compatibility** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1839](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1839) where [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) provided solutions for JSPI API support requiring Node.js 23 with experimental flags
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Infrastructure modernization** across multiple repositories with coordinated OCaml 5.3 adoption, Nix build system updates, and deprecated API removal
- **Documentation tooling enhancement** with [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) gaining multi-format support (LaTeX images, JSON metadata) and improved integration capabilities
- **Dependency reduction initiatives** exemplified by [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) systematic Stdune module removal suggesting broader ecosystem cleanup efforts
- **WASM backend maturation** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) with comprehensive runtime cleanup and type system consistency improvements affecting 880+ lines across 41 files

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major OCaml compiler development week with 20 commits in oxcaml/oxcaml and significant upstream integration in oxcaml/merlin
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Capsule Key API, runtime events enhancements, OCaml 5.2.0minus-6 compatibility, and extensive Flambda2 improvements
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Capsule Key API** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) providing runtime identification capabilities with Password.Id.t system ([c38d822](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/c38d82229060922e4fca1f276316d6dc1a7e37b0))
- **Runtime events path function** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) allowing retrieval of runtime events file path when collection is active ([5a3ff8f](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/5a3ff8f1a4e146525d36484dff4b98883fe71dbf))
- **Enhanced jkind bounds tracking** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with remember with bounds in unboxed products without -infer-with-bounds flag ([6afde76](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/6afde76b24250dde2f9d35f48df0c64ebbc99e0b))
- **OCaml 5.2.0minus-6 compatibility** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) integrating extensive typing system and zero allocation annotations ([oxcaml/merlin#132](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/132))
- **OCAMLRUNPARAM parameter renaming** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) from i= and j= to avoid runtime4 clashes ([6b3a654](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/6b3a65449c2dc3a5da505e7c0085b35cff24edb0))
- **Axis_set bitfield reimplementation** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) providing more efficient representation for axis operations ([3da7f8c](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/3da7f8c02585490212b0ffd5896eee528a8341e7))
- **Test server management improvements** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) fixing flaky test failures through proper server cleanup ([oxcaml/merlin#134](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/134))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **High-velocity development** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with 20 commits covering runtime events, capsule API, Flambda2 enhancements, and memory safety improvements
- **Major upstream integration** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with OCaml 5.2.0minus-6 compatibility update affecting 168 files and 17k+ line changes ([oxcaml/merlin#132](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/132))
- **Runtime stability focus** across [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with multiple fixes for runtime events, memory allocation failures, and garbage collection edge cases
- **Advanced compiler features** development including enhanced jkind bounds tracking, Flambda2 region tracking, and zero allocation analysis improvements
- **Test infrastructure hardening** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) addressing flaky test issues for improved CI stability ([oxcaml/merlin#134](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/134))
group_summaries.activity_summary: Extensive lambda function refactoring, Flambda2 optimizations, ephemeron GC fixes, and comprehensive compiler integration work
group_summaries.activity:
- **Lambda function system overhaul** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with significant changes to Lambda.lfunction structure including cleanup of ret_mode and region fields ([1a73a72](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/1a73a72b385049b6a1e9ded22cc74b68e614f62f))
- **Flambda2 parent region tracking** implementation in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) providing enhanced memory management capabilities for the advanced optimizer ([92d8707](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/92d8707a773ac497b9b3a63c6709421667130802))
- **Comprehensive compiler integration** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) by [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) affecting 168 files with enhanced typing system and persistent environment improvements ([oxcaml/merlin#132](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/132))
- **Ephemeron garbage collection improvements** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with proper clearing during minor GC cycles affecting weak reference behavior ([c1a0500](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/c1a05006ae138e7450c73117612369c0ef812eb1))
- **CMM unboxed field operations refactoring** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) improving backend code generation for unboxed record and variant field access ([d6971f8](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/d6971f8895e4296e8dda8bb84010beac2c7a1459))
- **Memory tracing enhancements** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) porting upstream memtrace improvements for better debugging capabilities ([eb3fbc8](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/eb3fbc8a18401d79e7dec8d2c525b2abec1aaa7a))
- **Test infrastructure improvements** across both repositories with functorized test enhancements in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) ([dbfaa32](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/dbfaa329313e6da42ab40336b4beff79db7bc84a)) and server lifecycle fixes in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) ([oxcaml/merlin#134](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/134))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Upstream compiler synchronization** between [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) and [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with merlin integrating extensive changes from the 5.2.0minus-6 compiler version ([oxcaml/merlin#132](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/132))
- **Zero allocation analysis** coordination with enhanced zero_alloc_assert fields and improved zero_alloc_check typing appearing in both compiler core ([oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)) and editor tooling ([oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin))
- **Enhanced typing system features** propagating from [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) jkind improvements to [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) configuration API updates including new mode interfaces
- **Runtime quotations development** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) by [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian) with ongoing [oxcaml/oxcaml#4395](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4395) representing significant language feature that will require merlin integration
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Runtime stability prioritization** with multiple fixes in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) addressing runtime events, memory allocation failures, and garbage collection edge cases
- **Advanced type system evolution** including enhanced jkind bounds tracking in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) ([6afde76](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/6afde76b24250dde2f9d35f48df0c64ebbc99e0b)) and layout system improvements
- **Flambda2 optimizer maturation** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with region tracking ([92d8707](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/92d8707a773ac497b9b3a63c6709421667130802)), axis optimizations ([a41be0f](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/a41be0f458ca4c0a0d5a3b51c9fd2eab1b343966)), and better compilation pipeline integration
- **Memory safety emphasis** through proper error handling for allocation failures and uninitialized pointer prevention in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) ([8597ee8](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/8597ee88fa5196993fca004e5d6854f194524a97))
- **Test infrastructure hardening** focus across both [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) and [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) addressing flaky test issues and improving development workflow reliability
- **API evolution patterns** in capsule system showing move toward more explicit runtime identification and better concurrency support in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) ([c38d822](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/c38d82229060922e4fca1f276316d6dc1a7e37b0))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Active week with new stdlib features, ARM64 improvements, and new RFC proposal for implicit source positions
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Format.format_text function, Runtime_events timestamp access, ARM64 unaligned memory access, Windows CSPRNG seeding
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Format.format_text function** added to stdlib for text formatting with automatic break hints in [ocaml/ocaml#3ca06d6e](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/3ca06d6e669aed7ca457d20f10fca133a38dc381)
- **Runtime_events.Timestamp.get_current** function for accessing current timestamps in [ocaml/ocaml#41d0c600](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/41d0c6009b27935109345f4491aae514f624bb3f)
- **ARM64 unaligned memory access** support enabled by setting allow_unaligned_access to true in [ocaml/ocaml#7ed394b8](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/7ed394b8dc3f1befdc4883f88e2ae311567409ae)
- **Windows CSPRNG random seeding** using OS cryptographically secure random number generator in [ocaml/ocaml#3ca06d6e](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/3ca06d6e669aed7ca457d20f10fca133a38dc381)
- **Enhanced spellchecker hints** that preserve module context ("Fun.protact" suggests "Fun.protect" instead of just "protect") in [ocaml/ocaml#22ab57de](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/22ab57de9c1ce8e4e313fa26b46bf90d2f549167)
- **Improved module type constraints** with distinction between `(module M : S)` and `(module M) : (module S)` syntax in [ocaml/ocaml#c8f31846](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/c8f318463f7127f1463fe446916a4b89e99267ab)
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **OCaml compiler development** progressed with substantial new features including stdlib enhancements, platform optimizations, and type system improvements across [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml)
- **Language design discussions** advanced with a new RFC proposal for implicit source positions and continued debate on include functor syntax in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs)
- **Industrial validation** emerged as a key theme with Jane Street's production experience informing language feature adoption, particularly for [ocaml/RFCs#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52)
- **Cross-platform improvements** delivered through ARM64 optimizations and Windows-specific enhancements in the main compiler
group_summaries.activity_summary: Major language features under development with polymorphic parameters and modular explicits, plus new RFC discussions
group_summaries.activity:
- **Major language features in development** including [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos)'s polymorphic parameters proposal in [ocaml/ocaml#13806](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13806) and [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1)'s ongoing modular explicits work in [ocaml/ocaml#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275)
- **Type system enhancements merged** including [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s)'s new Type_external kind in [ocaml/ocaml#13712](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13712) and variance printing support in [ocaml/ocaml#13820](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13820)
- **RFC proposal activity** with [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) opening the implicit source positions RFC in [ocaml/RFCs#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52) and continued technical discussion on include functor in [ocaml/RFCs#43](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/43)
- **Structured diagnostics advancement** through [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron)'s work in [ocaml/ocaml#13766](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13766) improving developer experience
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **RFC validation through production experience** as [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) noted Jane Street's several months of production use for implicit source positions in [ocaml/RFCs#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52), informing potential implementation in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml)
- **Maintainer consensus coordination** with [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) confirming broad maintainer agreement on implicit source positions across both repositories in [ocaml/RFCs#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52)
- **Language committee oversight** for complex features as [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) confirmed committee involvement for the include functor RFC in [ocaml/RFCs#43](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/43), ensuring proper review before compiler implementation
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Implicit source positions implementation strategy** discussed by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) regarding integration with BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP and build system compatibility in [ocaml/RFCs#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52)
- **Directory handling concerns** raised by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) about potential conflicts with existing build path mapping, while [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) provided Dune workspace insights in [ocaml/RFCs#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52)
- **Include functor syntax alternatives** debated with [François Pottier](https://github.com/fpottier) suggesting `this` keyword for current module reference and [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) exploring `include F(module)` syntax in [ocaml/RFCs#43](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/43)
- **Production validation insights** shared by [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) about Jane Street's internal implementation experience with implicit source positions in [ocaml/RFCs#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52)
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Industrial-to-upstream pipeline** where features like implicit source positions gain traction through company production experience before community adoption, as demonstrated by Jane Street's use in [ocaml/RFCs#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52)
- **Build system integration awareness** with increased attention to Dune compatibility and BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP considerations in language design discussions in [ocaml/RFCs#52](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/52)
- **Type system sophistication advancement** through polymorphic parameters in [ocaml/ocaml#13806](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13806), external type kinds in [ocaml/ocaml#13712](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13712), and variance annotations improving OCaml's expressiveness
- **Structured review processes** for complex language features as confirmed by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) regarding committee shepherd assignments in [ocaml/RFCs#43](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/43)

- __RUMINANT:core__ **Improved module type constraints** with distinction between `(module M : S)` and `(module M) : (module S)` syntax [ocaml/ocaml@c8f31846](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/c8f318463f7127f1463fe446916a4b89e99267ab)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Capsule Key API** providing runtime identification capabilities with Password.Id.t system [oxcaml/oxcaml@c38d822](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/c38d82229060922e4fca1f276316d6dc1a7e37b0)

- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Git libraries 3.18.0** comprehensive update across four git-related packages [ocaml/opam-repository@7e11968](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/7e11968a0543cd76c28fb5c432917c6ee2c60ec2)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **F* 2025.02.17** functional programming language compiler release [ocaml/opam-repository@52d7426](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/52d7426ee14a9bdb6071124c7546b1e447003fff)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **"Learn Programming with OCaml" book** added to ocaml.org books section with free PDF download [ocaml/ocaml.org#2962](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2962)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **LaTeX backend image support** in odoc with PNG, PDF, and JPEG image support by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) [ocaml/odoc#1297](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1297)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Opam lint enhancement** with new W74 warning detecting pin-depends packages missing from dependencies [ocaml/opam#6317](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6317)
